content: single_crochet into each chain being sure to go under two loops of the chain turn do not chain at the end of each row 8 single_crochet row 2 single_crochet under both loops of the first stitch single_crochet into the blo of the next 6 stitches single_crochet under both loops of the last stitch turn 8 single_crochet repeat row 2 until waistband when stretched is long enough to fit over your hips or waist whichever is wider you will want to test the waistband as you crochet if your hips are wider than your waist the drawstring you add at the end will cinch it to fit your waist when making my skirts i made 112 row on the cotton skirt and 120 row on the acrylic skirt to fit a size 28w jeans/size small ideally you want a multiple of 8 row for this pattern so as you re trying on the waistband for size try adding or subtracting 8 row at a time however you can adjust the stitch count when stitching your first body row into the waistband so having a multiple of 8 at this point is not critical once your waistband is at desired length turn and slip_stitch your ends together i do this by folding the band in half and starting from the working end go in through the front loop of the first stitch and the first chain you made at the start of your work and make a slip_stitch then go in through the front loop of the next stitch and the next starting chain and slip stitch all the way to the end doing it like this will leave a ridge that mimics the ridge created by the blo stitches at the seam body of skirt row 1 right side rs continuing from where you are chain 1 then make 1 single_crochet per row along the edge join with a slip_stitch to the first single_crochet turn your stitch count should be a multiple of 8 after this row is completed optional increase/decrease if your row count is not a multiple of 8 or if you wish for the body of the skirt to be narrower or wider than the waistband based on your own body shape you can increase or decrease the count in this first row of single crochets i recommend distributing your increases or decreases evenly where the sides of your waist would be the seam on the band being at the center of the back of the skirt to increase add extra single crochets to decrease i recommend doing single crochets 2 together rather than skipping row so you don t have large gaps in this row along the band to single crochet 2 together insert your hook and draw up a loop then insert your hook in the next space and draw up a loop then yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on your hook row 2 wrong side ws this row is the
